result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kolya Kenta Willis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Kolya Kenta Willis.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defendant has been revoked on another case.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing be set. State confirm there is a victim in this case.  Defendant to be produced for next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court for Kolya Kenta Willis.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Court advised of possible revocation.  Defense requests adjourned scheduling conference date.  Request granted.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES, THIS HEARING WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Kolya Kenta Willis in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kolya Kenta Willis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
